page.title: 02Local history
page.content: Paull used to be a quiet country village.It hadn't any running water. Turpits lane was called Turpits Pump because there was a water pump at the end of it.There were only about 50 to 70 houses in the village but that was a long time ago. The shipyard used to be a museum then and had exhibits of local folk lore and customs. The bus service came to Paull in 1927 but the biggest change was when water and electricity came to Paull. Men had to get up early to go codding and shrimping. The main street was called Town Street then and all of Paull was called Paghill.Anson Villas got its name from HMS Anson, a ship which took soldiers from Paull Battery to fight in the First World War.
